overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: Extensions must declare all required permissions in their manifest.json. Users review and approve these permissions during installation. This ensures transparency and gives users control over what extensions can access.

database.title: Database Permissions
database.intro: Database permissions control access to tables from other extensions. The target must be the full table name in the format {publicKey}__{extensionName}__{tableName}:
database.ownTablesNote: Extensions can create, read, and modify their own tables within their namespace without any permissions. Permissions are only required when accessing tables from other extensions.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.warning: Extensions that request excessive permissions may be flagged during marketplace review.

minimal.title: Request Minimal Permissions
minimal.description: Only request permissions your extension actually needs. Users are more likely to install extensions with fewer permission requests.

specific.title: Be Specific
specific.description: Use specific table names and URL patterns instead of wildcards. This makes your extension's behavior more predictable and trustworthy.

explain.title: Explain Why
explain.description: When requesting permissions at runtime, provide a clear reason why the permission is needed.

graceful.title: Handle Denials Gracefully
graceful.description: If a permission is denied, provide a good user experience. Show a helpful message and offer alternatives if possible.
